name: Create a New Project
description: Set up a fresh project directory. This is your blank canvas — every design-to-code journey starts here.

name: Run a Dev Server
description: Start a local server so you can preview your work in a browser in real-time. See changes instantly as Claude builds your UI.

name: Use Screenshots for Feedback
description: Take a screenshot of your running app and share it with Claude. The most natural way to give feedback — just show it what needs fixing.

name: Set Up GitHub
description: Connect your project to GitHub for version control. This protects your work and lets you collaborate with engineers on their terms.

name: Use a GitHub Branch
description: Create a separate branch to work on without affecting the main code. Essential for safe experimentation — you can always throw it away.

name: Push to Main
description: Merge your branch back into main and push it. This is how your changes become official and available to the rest of the team.

name: Connect Figma MCP
description: Link Figma directly to Claude Code so it can see your actual design files — not just descriptions of them. This is the bridge between design and code.

name: Build a Screen from Figma
description: Give Claude a Figma link and have it generate the full UI in code. The closest thing to dragging a design straight into a codebase.

name: Iterate with Screenshots
description: Screenshot your build, compare it to the Figma design, and tell Claude what to fix. This is the design QA loop — refine until it's pixel-perfect.

name: Build Multiple Screens
description: Build more than one screen from your Figma file. Scale from a single page prototype to a full multi-screen app.

name: Create a Chatbot (LLM Key)
description: Build a project that uses an AI API key, like a chatbot. Learn how real AI-powered features connect under the hood.

name: Use Playwright to Test
description: Use browser automation to navigate your local site and verify it works. Automated QA without manual clicking through every page.

name: Deploy to a Public URL
description: Ship your project to the internet so anyone can see it. Share a real, clickable URL with stakeholders — not just a screenshot.

name: Edit CLAUDE.md
description: Customize how Claude behaves in your project by editing its instructions file. Set your preferences, conventions, and constraints.

name: Create INTENT.md
description: Create a file that preserves your project context across Claude sessions. It picks up where you left off — even after closing the terminal.

name: Create a Claude Skill
description: Build a custom slash command that packages a complex workflow into a single action. Your own personalized Claude superpower.
